data.text:
Twenty Years | One Shot

AU!Bucky x Reader

Warnings: angst

Your heart was breaking.

Absolutely shattering. But he couldn‚Äôt know that. No, you wouldn‚Äôt ruin this for him. He was happy. Over the moon. In love. Constantly bragging about how amazing she was. How beautiful. How perfect. How sexy. It hurt like hell.

And he was getting married tomorrow.

‚ÄúEarth to, Y/N,‚Äù he chuckled, pulling you from your thoughts. God, you needed to walk away. Cut the strings. Save yourself from any more pain. Any more torture. You needed to move on. ‚ÄúWhere‚Äôs your mind, Dollface? You look like you checked out about twenty minutes ago.‚Äù

Instead of a bachelor party, he‚Äôd insisted on hanging out with you. Movies, pizza. Beers. Bucky had chosen you over his other friends. Over an actual night out. He said he wanted to spend his last night as a free man with his best friend.

Friend.

Fuck, that hurt.

Twenty years. Middle school. High school. College. You‚Äôd been in love with him. And he was blind to it. Completely oblivious. He loved you, of course. He‚Äôd tell you that regularly. But he didn‚Äôt love you, love you. Not like you loved him. And you‚Äôd reached a breaking point.

You couldn‚Äôt do this anymore. It was too hard. Too much. So much pain seeing him fall completely in love with someone who wasn‚Äôt you. I should have been you. You‚Äôd been there through everything. Held his hand. His one constant, he always said. Yeah, old reliable. Always there.

You were done.

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs on your mind, sugar? Really? Because you look all kinds of fucked up right now. Work draining you? You broke up with that asshole, right? Mark, Matt? Whatever his name is.‚Äù

‚ÄúMike,‚Äù you replied. Yeah, you‚Äôd ended it. Because he wasn‚Äôt Bucky. He‚Äôd never come close. No one would ever come close. You hated it. Not like you hadn‚Äôt tried. Dating over and over. One night stands. Anything to drown the ache. The sheer pain of not having the one you wanted.

You‚Äôd made up your mind. You weren‚Äôt going to that damn wedding.

****

Bucky paced. Anxious. Scared. What if something had happened to you? Had you gotten in an accident on your way to the church? You weren‚Äôt answering your phone. It was going straight to voicemail. Where were you? He didn‚Äôt want to do this without you beside him. He couldn‚Äôt.

You‚Äôd always been his rock. His closest friend. Family to him. Held him up when his mother died. Wiped his tears. You‚Äôd been there for him for every important moment for twenty years. And this was the most important one. You were nowhere to be found.

‚ÄúReady?,‚Äù Steve asked from the door, noting Bucky‚Äôs nerves. He chalked it up to the fact that he was getting married. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs not here, Steve,‚Äù he said, a bit of panic in his voice. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs supposed to be here. I don‚Äôt wanna do this without her. I can‚Äôt.‚Äù

‚ÄúI think your bride would beg to differ.‚Äù

****

2:00

It would be starting now. He‚Äôd be standing at the alter. Steve would step up in your place. Bucky wouldn‚Äôt be alone today. He‚Äôd be fine. You on the other hand...not so much. You felt immense guilt. Sharp pain in your chest. But you couldn‚Äôt watch it. Him give himself completely to her.

You picked up your phone. You needed to do it. He needed to hear it. Needed to understand. He‚Äôd get it later tonight. Maybe tomorrow on his way to the airport. Paris. Fucking Paris. Of course she‚Äôd choose that. You‚Äôd mentioned it before. That you wanted to go. Bucky had jokingly promised to take you someday.

It seemed only fitting. Another knife in the chest. Another stab in the heart.

Hey, it‚Äôs Bucky. You know what to do

You let out a breath. Do or die.

‚ÄúHey, it‚Äôs me. I just...I wanna say I‚Äôm sorry, Buck. I know you wanted me there. And I...I wanted to be there for you. But I can‚Äôt, I just can‚Äôt do it. I don‚Äôt expect you to forgive me. Hell, I wouldn‚Äôt. It‚Äôs a dick move on my part. Absolutely cowardly. But, fuck, I love you. I‚Äôve loved you since the moment I laid eyes on you. History class. You had the blue backpack. Matched your eyes. You stole my heart when you asked for a pencil,‚Äù you let out a soft chuckle.

‚ÄúI never let go. I held on, hoping someday you‚Äôd see me differently. See me the same way I see you. But, life is shit. It never happened. And I‚Äôm happy for you. I am. Honestly. I‚Äôm glad she makes you happy. Rose is good for you, I guess. I don‚Äôt know. She hates me, but whatever. She makes you smile, so I suppose that‚Äôs a good thing. You‚Äôre smile makes me weak, Buck. Your laugh warms my heart.‚Äù

Tears flowed freely now. There was no going back.

‚ÄúI hate that I‚Äôm not there. You‚Äôre probably upset. Disappointed. I get it. I ruined it. You have every right to hate me. I don‚Äôt blame you. But you needed to know. I love you, James Buchanan Barnes. I always will. Forever. I‚Äôm sorry.‚Äù

****

Bucky sat in shock as he listened. He needed to be inside now, waiting for his bride to be. He was stalling, he knew that. Rose was probably panicked. Scared. Maybe even angry. He didn‚Äôt blame her. He was having second thoughts now. Your words cut like a knife.

How long? How could he have been so blind to what was in front of him all along. Twenty years.

‚ÄúBuck‚Ä¶,‚Äù Steve tried to urge, but Bucky couldn‚Äôt move. He was frozen. ‚ÄúBuck. People are getting restless.‚Äù

Becca came around the corner, eyes locked on her big brother. She knew that look. This wasn‚Äôt just nerves. Something had rocked him to his core. Something shook him up. She dropped to her knees in front of him. ‚ÄúJames? Look at me. What‚Äôs wrong?‚Äù

He lifted his head. His sister‚Äôs worried expression pulling him back. He said nothing, just simply handed over his phone, playing the message back for her. Her eyes widened at your words, not surprised you loved him. Surprised you admitted it.

‚ÄúAbout time,‚Äù she muttered. Bucky looked shocked. How long had Becca known? ‚ÄúThe whole time,‚Äù she responded as if she could read his mind. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs glaringly obvious, Bucky. Shoulda been her today. If you weren‚Äôt so dense.‚Äù

Could he fix this? Repair it? Make up for twenty years of pain. Twenty years of pining for him?

‚ÄúWhat do I do?,‚Äù he asked her, worry laced in his tone.

She smiled up at him. ‚ÄúYou do the right thing.‚Äù

Fire In His Veins

Mickey x Reader

Fire in his veins.

That‚Äôs what Mickey felt every time you were near him. But he didn‚Äôt know how to express himself though, so he kept it to himself. That ache, that yearning. That drive and need for you. He‚Äôd just keep it close to the chest because deep down he knew you didn‚Äôt feel the same.

He watched. You swayed to the music. The bass was loud, thrumming. He couldn‚Äôt make out any actual words, not that it mattered. All he could focus on was you. The way your hips moved. Lips parted just a bit. The man behind you had his hands on you and Mickey saw red. He wanted you, didn‚Äôt want to see you with someone else.

He had to have his way.

He sat his beer down and stalked toward you. Time to throw caution to the wind, time to stake his claim. Tonight would change everything, that he was sure of. A wave of courage - just a little one - was all he needed. ‚ÄúHey,‚Äù he breathed in your ear before locking eyes with the man behind you. A get lost look in his eyes.

‚ÄúMickey,‚Äù you shook your head. Fuck, what was he doing. You didn‚Äôt want him. Did you? ‚ÄúJust wanna make sure you‚Äôre dancing with someone you know, sweetheart. Not some stranger. Yeah? Dance with me?‚Äù You nodded and he grinned, gently gripping your hips. This was it. This was his chance, his moment.

The beat slowed, so did you. Your hips swaying slowly, made Mickey‚Äôs mind race, go to every dirty place imaginable. He wanted to feel you, so he moved behind, not letting go. ‚ÄúKeep moving,‚Äù he whispered, lips pressed against your ear, the hot breath making you shiver. ‚ÄúMickey,‚Äù you breathed and he chuckled.

This was what he‚Äôd wanted.

‚ÄúCome on.‚Äù

He held out a hand and you took it, letting him lead you away from the dance floor, finding a somewhat quiet corner. He had you pinned against the wall, heavy breath on your neck. ‚ÄúWanted this for so long,‚Äù he panted. He was on fire for you. You could feel him through the thin pants he wore. And he knew it. ‚ÄúYou want it.‚Äù

You nodded.

He lifted the skirt of your dress and immediately pushed two fingers inside. ‚ÄúNeed to know how you feel,‚Äù he panted. ‚ÄúSo wet, so ready.‚Äù You nodded again, barely able to form a coherent word. ‚ÄúGotta get you ready,‚Äù he whispered, his lips a breath away from yours. ‚ÄúGotta get you ready for me.‚Äù You were panting, nearly in tears as he reached deeper, fingers brushing over that spot. He had you.

‚ÄúBaby, come.‚Äù

That was all you needed. Soaking his fingers with your release. ‚ÄúGood girl. So good for me.‚Äù He fumbled with his zipper, releasing himself and pushed into your waiting heat without a warning. ‚ÄúGod, baby,‚Äù he panted, ‚Äúyou‚Äôre so wet. So hot. That all for me? Did I get you that hot and bothered?‚Äù You nodded, eyes screwed shut, biting down on your bottom lip.

‚ÄúEyes open, sweetheart. I wanna see your face when I make you fall apart.‚Äù

Absolute fire in Mickey‚Äôs veins.

On fire for you.

He wanted to blow, but he needed to hold out just a bit longer. He wanted you to come again, he wanted to see the look on your face, the fire in your eyes. Wanted to hear every little moan and whimper. Every time you begged for just a little more. He wanted to give you everything. Wanted to give it all to you.

You came again, squeezing the life out of him, making him wince. It was too good, too perfect. The ultimate high. Mickey wanted to weep, he‚Äôd never felt anything as good as you. No one had ever made him feel like this before, the way you fit him perfectly. Like you were made for him. And he was sure that you were. How long had he wanted this? Wanted you?

‚ÄúMickey. Come.‚Äù

That was it, that‚Äôs what he needed. The whine in your voice, the way your face was screwed up in absolute pleasure. He knew you‚Äôd come again, he could feel your walls clenching, he could feel you were so close to letting go again. ‚ÄúBaby, fuck!,‚Äù he cried out, fingers gripping your hips hard enough to leave bruises. Hard enough to mark you up.

‚ÄúOh fuck, sweetheart,‚Äù he whined, feeling you let go a third time, pushing him into his own orgasm. Harder, stronger, more powerful than he‚Äôd had in so long. Like you were absolutely meant for him. ‚ÄúBaby, god,‚Äù he panted, his head resting on your shoulder, as you both came down from your highs. ‚ÄúHow long?,‚Äù you asked and he looked up at you. ‚ÄúHow long, Mickey?‚Äù

He grinned.

‚ÄúToo long, sweetheart. Too damn long.‚Äù

Levels of bad, from light bad to worst ! Is there levels of good ? Oh Fin‚Äôs ‚Äúmy‚Äù partner, I‚Äôm sure he‚Äôs an amazing mentor ! He‚Äôs so experimented. Upper East Side, rich rapist so. All of them are bags of shit though ! Fin Tutola experimented and knowing practical places, one of the best !

You took a hard elbow to the ribs that left you momentarily stunned before you hauled the suspect to the ground‚Ä¶.and he pulled you down with him. Into the pile of garbage bags. Then more scuffling, which broke open some of those garbage bags.

‚ÄúI‚Äù arrested him but now ‚ÄúI‚Äôm‚Äù full of dirt, but the most important is that ‚ÄúI‚Äù arrested a rapist ! Ya bet ‚ÄúI‚Äôm‚Äù want to throw up ‚Äúmy‚Äù food because of the smell.

Fin thought it was hilarious, and he alternated between laughing and gagging at the smell the entire ride back to the precinct.

This isn‚Äôt really nice Fin ! How ‚Äúmy‚Äù dad can go worse than diving in trash ? Oh stupid ‚Äúme‚Äù, ‚ÄúI‚Äù let spare clothes at home‚Ä¶ Oh I feel like there‚Äôs something wrong with the gym clothes too haha.

You had never felt such desire ‚Äì probably because you had developed early, and could hardly remember what it was like to not navigate the world with larger breasts while drawing unwanted attention from men.

Never understood the thing people have for big breasts like they‚Äôre always staring at it and make a big deal out of it. I mean I say it as someone with big breasts and I never understood that obsession of people, men especially, for big breasts, as if it was something unusual‚Ä¶

The day was nearly over, and you didn‚Äôt have court or anything public-facing. You just had to run out the clock at your desk.

Thank god, because with gym clothes, no one would have listen to ‚Äúme‚Äù seriously. Oh god, that gym t-shirt, everything to accentuate ‚Äúmy‚Äù boobs, great‚Ä¶

in a t-shirt with picture of a box on the front, and the legend ‚ÄúSchr√∂dinger did it for the pussy‚Äù writ large across your chest.

But maybe no one would notice.

Not sure that ‚ÄúI‚Äôll‚Äù be that lucky unfortunately !

Amanda gave a low whistle, which made Sonny‚Äôs head swivel around to follow her gaze. To land on you. More specifically, to land on your chest.

Jesus fucking Christ Amanda Rollins‚Ä¶ For sure he‚Äôs not looking at ‚Äúmy‚Äù eyes‚Ä¶ Sonny is embarrassed and Amanda in high spirits. Will be an amazing end of the day ! Awww ‚ÄúI‚Äù have a cat !!! I feel the thing of feeling like a teen even if you‚Äôre an adult, I have that feeling a lot.

You looked up but refused to quite meet his gaze ‚Äì you had a small infatuation for the man, and the coolly professional vibe you had been trying to put out there was effectively dead now.

So dead, in ‚Äúmy‚Äù embarrassment‚Ä¶ Awww he lends ‚Äúme‚Äù his hoodie. That‚Äôs cute. He also thinks about people that could harass ‚Äúme‚Äù while ‚ÄúI‚Äù go back home in the subway. He‚Äôs protective.

‚ÄúNo rush.‚Äù He reached up and rubbed his neck again, and you wondered if he was aware of it. ‚ÄúIt, uh, looks good on you.‚Äù

Is he trying to make ‚Äúme‚Äù understand something ?

He said it was clean, but it smelled like Sonny.

Well it‚Äôs better that it smells Sonny than smelling garbage. Oh Sonny & Amanda whispering over ‚Äúme‚Äù‚Ä¶ So, Sonny‚Äôs got a thing for ‚Äúme‚Äù. Is Amanda really laughing at ‚Äúus‚Äù now ? Oh ‚Äúwe‚Äù do live in the same neighborhood ! And for once Amanda had a good idea. Better than imitating a teen in high school. Just Sonny & ‚Äúme‚Äù in a car.

Small talk in the car. Poor Sonny, in a cold river during one of the coldest months of the year‚Ä¶ Ooooh car-pool for going to work. This will get ‚Äúus‚Äù closer and closer.

And ‚ÄúI‚Äù win a sweatshirt smelling like Dominick Carisi, this day doesn‚Äôt end that bad !
